properties.name: alignment
properties.description: Specifies the table's alignment against the page margin.

examples.description: Set a table's alignment to center it on the page

properties.name: allowBreakAcrossPage
properties.description: Specifies whether lines in tables formatted with a specified style break across pages.

examples.description: Configure a table style to prevent table rows from breaking across pages

properties.name: bottomCellMargin
properties.description: Specifies the amount of space to add between the contents and the bottom borders of the cells.

examples.description: Set the bottom cell margin to 10 points for a table style to add spacing between cell content and bottom borders

properties.name: cellSpacing
properties.description: Specifies the spacing (in points) between the cells in a table style.

examples.description: Set the cell spacing to 5 points for a table style named "CustomTableStyle"

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a TableStyle object to verify the connection to the Word document before applying style changes.

properties.name: leftCellMargin
properties.description: Specifies the amount of space to add between the contents and the left borders of the cells.

examples.description: Set the left cell margin to 10 points for a table style to add spacing between cell content and the left border

properties.name: rightCellMargin
properties.description: Specifies the amount of space to add between the contents and the right borders of the cells.

examples.description: Set the right cell margin to 15 points for a table style to add spacing between cell content and right borders

properties.name: topCellMargin
properties.description: Specifies the amount of space to add between the contents and the top borders of the cells.

examples.description: Set the top cell margin to 10 points for a table style to add spacing between cell content and top borders

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the name and alignment properties of the first table's style in the document.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Update multiple properties of a table style at once, including font name, font size, and alignment settings.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.TableStyle object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.TableStyleData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Retrieve a table style's properties as a plain JavaScript object and log it to the console for debugging or serialization purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Get a table style by name, track it across multiple sync calls, and modify its properties while maintaining the object reference

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Get a table style, apply it to a table, then untrack the style object to free memory after use
